name: CMMC 2.0
description: The Cybersecurity Maturity Model Certification (CMMC) 2.0 is a comprehensive framework developed by the U.S. Department of Defense to ensure that defense industrial base (DIB) contractors implement adequate cybersecurity practices to protect Federal Contract Information (FCI) and Controlled Unclassified Information (CUI). CMMC 2.0 streamlines the model into three levels aligned with NIST SP 800-171 and NIST SP 800-172.

domains.name: Access Control
domains.description: Limit information system access to authorized users, processes acting on behalf of authorized users, or devices. Manage access to systems and data based on least privilege and separation of duties principles.

controls.title: Authorized Access Control
controls.description: Limit information system access to authorized users, processes acting on behalf of authorized users, or devices (including other information systems).

controls.title: Transaction and Function Control
controls.description: Limit information system access to the types of transactions and functions that authorized users are permitted to execute.

controls.title: External Connections
controls.description: Verify and control/limit connections to and use of external information systems.

controls.title: Control Public Information
controls.description: Control information posted or processed on publicly accessible information systems.

controls.title: Account Management
controls.description: Establish and manage information system accounts including creating, enabling, modifying, disabling, and removing accounts in accordance with policy.

controls.title: Access Enforcement
controls.description: Enforce approved authorizations for logical access to information and system resources in accordance with applicable access control policies.

controls.title: Information Flow Enforcement
controls.description: Control the flow of CUI in accordance with approved authorizations, including restricting data flows between networks and systems.

controls.title: Separation of Duties
controls.description: Separate the duties of individuals to reduce the risk of malevolent activity without collusion.

controls.title: Least Privilege
controls.description: Employ the principle of least privilege, including for specific security functions and privileged accounts.

controls.title: Unsuccessful Logon Attempts
controls.description: Limit unsuccessful logon attempts to prevent brute-force attacks and unauthorized access.

controls.title: Privacy and Security Notices
controls.description: Provide privacy and security notices consistent with applicable CUI rules, including system use notification banners.

controls.title: Session Lock
controls.description: Use session lock with pattern-hiding displays to prevent access and viewing of data after a period of inactivity.

controls.title: Session Termination
controls.description: Terminate (automatically) a user session after a defined condition such as inactivity timeout or session duration limit.

controls.title: Remote Access Control
controls.description: Monitor and control remote access sessions, employing cryptographic mechanisms to protect confidentiality of remote access sessions.
typical_evidence: Multi-factor authentication records for remote access

controls.title: Wireless Access Control
controls.description: Authorize, monitor, and control wireless access to organizational systems.

controls.title: Mobile Device Access
controls.description: Control connection and access from mobile devices, including enforcing configuration requirements and connection requirements.

controls.title: CUI on External Systems
controls.description: Limit use of portable storage devices on external systems and control CUI on personally owned systems.

controls.title: Enhanced Access Control Mechanisms
controls.description: Employ enhanced authentication and access control mechanisms such as attribute-based access control and dynamic risk-based policies for CUI access.

domains.name: Awareness and Training
domains.description: Ensure that personnel are aware of the security risks associated with their activities and of the applicable policies, standards, and procedures related to the security of organizational systems.

controls.title: Security Awareness
controls.description: Ensure that managers, systems administrators, and users of organizational systems are made aware of the security risks associated with their activities and applicable policies.

controls.title: Role-Based Security Training
controls.description: Provide security awareness training on recognizing and reporting potential indicators of insider threat and role-specific training for personnel with security responsibilities.

controls.title: Insider Threat Awareness
controls.description: Provide awareness training focused on recognizing and reporting potential indicators of insider threat activity.
typical_evidence: Case study examples used in training

controls.title: Practical Security Exercises
controls.description: Conduct practical exercises such as phishing simulations, social engineering tests, and hands-on security drills to reinforce security awareness and measure training effectiveness.

controls.title: Advanced Threat Training
controls.description: Provide advanced cybersecurity training addressing current threats, advanced persistent threats, and sophisticated attack techniques relevant to CUI protection.

domains.name: Audit and Accountability
domains.description: Create, protect, and retain information system audit records to enable monitoring, analysis, investigation, and reporting of unlawful, unauthorized, or inappropriate system activity.

controls.title: System Auditing
controls.description: Create and retain system audit logs and records to the extent needed to enable monitoring, analysis, investigation, and reporting of unlawful or unauthorized system activity.

controls.title: User Accountability
controls.description: Ensure that the actions of individual system users can be uniquely traced to those users so they can be held accountable for their actions.
typical_evidence: Authentication logs tied to user IDs

controls.title: Event Review
controls.description: Review and update logged events on a defined frequency and when changes occur to the system.

controls.title: Audit Alerting
controls.description: Alert in the event of an audit logging process failure and take defined actions in response.

controls.title: Audit Correlation
controls.description: Correlate audit record review, analysis, and reporting processes for investigation and response to indications of unlawful, unauthorized, suspicious, or unusual activity.

controls.title: Audit Reduction and Reporting
controls.description: Provide audit record reduction and report generation capability to support on-demand analysis and reporting.

controls.title: Authoritative Time Source
controls.description: Provide time synchronization using authoritative time sources to enable accurate timestamps in audit records.

controls.title: Audit Record Protection
controls.description: Protect audit information and audit logging tools from unauthorized access, modification, and deletion.

controls.title: Advanced Audit Analytics
controls.description: Employ advanced automated mechanisms to integrate and analyze audit records from multiple sources across the enterprise for enhanced situational awareness.

domains.name: Configuration Management
domains.description: Establish and maintain baseline configurations and inventories of organizational systems throughout their system development life cycles.

controls.title: Baseline Configuration
controls.description: Establish and maintain baseline configurations and inventories of organizational systems (including hardware, software, firmware, and documentation) throughout the respective system development life cycles.

controls.title: Security Configuration Settings
controls.description: Establish and enforce security configuration settings for information technology products employed in organizational systems.

controls.title: System Change Management
controls.description: Track, review, approve or disapprove, and log changes to organizational systems, maintaining audit trails of all changes.

controls.title: Security Impact Analysis
controls.description: Analyze the security impact of changes prior to implementation to identify potential risks and required mitigations.

controls.title: Access Restrictions for Change
controls.description: Define, document, approve, and enforce physical and logical access restrictions associated with changes to organizational systems.

controls.title: Least Functionality
controls.description: Employ the principle of least functionality by configuring organizational systems to provide only essential capabilities and restrict the use of non-essential functions, ports, protocols, and services.

controls.title: Software Usage Restrictions
controls.description: Apply deny-by-exception (blacklisting) or allow-by-exception (whitelisting) policies to control software allowed to execute on organizational systems.

controls.title: User-Installed Software
controls.description: Control and monitor user-installed software to prevent unauthorized or malicious software installations.

controls.title: Advanced Configuration Management
controls.description: Employ automated mechanisms to maintain, apply, and verify baseline configurations and detect unauthorized changes across all system components.

domains.name: Identification and Authentication
domains.description: Identify information system users, processes acting on behalf of users, or devices and authenticate (or verify) the identities of those users, processes, or devices as a prerequisite to allowing access.

controls.title: User Identification
controls.description: Identify information system users, processes acting on behalf of users, or devices.

controls.title: Authentication
controls.description: Authenticate (or verify) the identities of those users, processes, or devices, as a prerequisite to allowing access to organizational information systems.

controls.title: Multi-Factor Authentication
controls.description: Use multi-factor authentication for local and network access to privileged accounts and for network access to non-privileged accounts.

controls.title: Replay-Resistant Authentication
controls.description: Implement replay-resistant authentication mechanisms for network access to privileged and non-privileged accounts.

controls.title: Identifier Management
controls.description: Manage information system identifiers by receiving authorization, issuing, disabling, and preventing reuse of identifiers for a defined period.

controls.title: Authenticator Management
controls.description: Manage information system authenticators by verifying identity before issuance, establishing initial authenticator content, enforcing strength and complexity, and protecting authenticators.

controls.title: Authenticator Feedback
controls.description: Obscure feedback of authentication information during the authentication process to protect from exploitation.
typical_evidence: Security testing results for authentication feedback

controls.title: Cryptographic Authentication
controls.description: Store and transmit only cryptographically-protected passwords using approved cryptographic algorithms.

controls.title: Hardware-Based Authentication
controls.description: Employ hardware-based authentication mechanisms such as hardware tokens, smart cards, or biometric devices for access to CUI systems.
typical_evidence: Hardware token inventory and assignment records

domains.name: Incident Response
domains.description: Establish an operational incident-handling capability for organizational systems that includes preparation, detection, analysis, containment, recovery, and user response activities.

controls.title: Incident Handling
controls.description: Establish an operational incident-handling capability for organizational systems that includes preparation, detection, analysis, containment, recovery, and user response activities.

controls.title: Incident Reporting
controls.description: Track, document, and report incidents to designated officials and/or authorities both internal and external to the organization.

controls.title: Incident Response Testing
controls.description: Test the organizational incident response capability at defined intervals to determine its effectiveness.

controls.title: Incident Response Lessons Learned
controls.description: Incorporate lessons learned from ongoing incident handling activities and industry best practices into incident response procedures, training, and testing.
typical_evidence: Corrective action tracking from incident reviews

controls.title: Advanced Incident Response Operations
controls.description: Establish and maintain a security operations center capability with advanced threat detection, automated response, and coordination with intelligence sharing organizations.

domains.name: Maintenance
domains.description: Perform timely maintenance on organizational systems and provide effective controls on tools, techniques, mechanisms, and personnel used to conduct maintenance.

controls.title: System Maintenance
controls.description: Perform maintenance on organizational systems in a timely manner, using approved maintenance tools and keeping maintenance records.

controls.title: Maintenance Tools
controls.description: Inspect and approve maintenance tools carried into a facility and monitor their use. Check media containing diagnostic programs for malicious code.
typical_evidence: Media scanning logs for maintenance tools

controls.title: Remote Maintenance
controls.description: Require multi-factor authentication to establish remote maintenance sessions and terminate connections when remote maintenance is complete.
typical_evidence: Remote session logs with connection/disconnection timestamps

controls.title: Maintenance Personnel
controls.description: Supervise maintenance activities of maintenance personnel without required access authorization and ensure cleared personnel observe maintenance activities.
typical_evidence: Supervision logs for uncleared maintenance staff

controls.title: Equipment Sanitization
controls.description: Check media containing diagnostic and test programs for malicious code before use, and sanitize equipment for off-site maintenance of all CUI.
typical_evidence: Malware scan logs for maintenance media
Off-site maintenance authorization and sanitization forms

controls.title: Advanced Maintenance Controls
controls.description: Employ automated mechanisms to schedule, conduct, and document maintenance and provide up-to-date, complete, and accurate records of all maintenance activities.
typical_evidence: Automated compliance verification for maintenance activities

domains.name: Media Protection
domains.description: Protect information system media containing CUI, both paper and digital, limit access to CUI on media to authorized users, and sanitize or destroy media before disposal or release.

controls.title: Media Disposal
controls.description: Sanitize or destroy information system media containing Federal Contract Information before disposal or release for reuse.

controls.title: Media Access
controls.description: Limit access to CUI on system media to authorized users and restrict media containing CUI to controlled areas.

controls.title: Media Marking
controls.description: Mark media with necessary CUI markings and distribution limitations to ensure proper handling and prevent unauthorized disclosure.

controls.title: Media Storage
controls.description: Protect CUI at rest by controlling storage of digital and non-digital media in physically secure locations.

controls.title: Media Transport
controls.description: Control the transport of media containing CUI outside of controlled areas using encryption or tamper-evident protections.

controls.title: CUI Media Sanitization
controls.description: Sanitize or destroy CUI media before disposal or release for reuse using NIST SP 800-88 guidelines.
typical_evidence: CUI sanitization procedures aligned to NIST 800-88

controls.title: Advanced Media Protection
controls.description: Employ cryptographic mechanisms to protect CUI stored on digital media during transport and enforce dual-authorization for sanitization and destruction of critical media.
typical_evidence: Cryptographic key management for media encryption

domains.name: Personnel Security
domains.description: Screen individuals prior to authorizing access to organizational systems containing CUI and ensure that CUI and systems are protected during and after personnel actions such as terminations and transfers.

controls.title: Personnel Screening
controls.description: Screen individuals prior to authorizing access to organizational systems containing CUI with background investigations and re-investigations.

controls.title: Personnel Termination and Transfer
controls.description: Ensure that CUI and organizational systems containing CUI are protected during and after personnel actions such as terminations and transfers, including revoking access promptly.

controls.title: Third-Party Personnel Security
controls.description: Establish personnel security requirements including security roles and responsibilities for third-party providers and monitor third-party personnel compliance.

controls.title: Enhanced Personnel Security
controls.description: Implement enhanced personnel security measures including continuous evaluation, insider threat monitoring, and periodic reinvestigation for personnel with access to critical CUI.

domains.name: Physical Protection
domains.description: Limit physical access to organizational systems, equipment, and operating environments to authorized individuals, and protect the physical plant and support infrastructure.

controls.title: Limit Physical Access
controls.description: Limit physical access to organizational information systems, equipment, and the respective operating environments to authorized individuals.

controls.title: Escort Visitors
controls.description: Escort visitors and monitor visitor activity, maintain audit logs of physical access, and control physical access devices.

controls.title: Physical Access Logs
controls.description: Maintain audit logs of physical access to facilities and equipment, including entry and exit records for areas containing information systems.

controls.title: Physical Access Monitoring
controls.description: Protect and monitor the physical facility and support infrastructure, including surveillance, intrusion detection, and alarm systems.
typical_evidence: Guard service contracts and patrol logs

controls.title: Physical Access Control
controls.description: Control and manage physical access devices including keys, combinations, and card-based access systems. Enforce physical access authorizations at entry and exit points.

controls.title: CUI Work Area Controls
controls.description: Manage physical access to CUI work areas by enforcing clean desk policies, controlling visual access, and restricting entry to designated areas.

controls.title: Alternative Work Sites
controls.description: Enforce safeguarding measures at alternate work sites where CUI may be processed or stored, including remote work locations.

controls.title: Advanced Physical Security
controls.description: Employ advanced physical security measures including multi-factor physical authentication, real-time physical intrusion detection, and automated physical access management integrated with logical access controls.

domains.name: Risk Assessment
domains.description: Periodically assess the risk to organizational operations, organizational assets, and individuals resulting from the operation of organizational systems and the processing, storage, or transmission of CUI.

controls.title: Risk Assessment
controls.description: Periodically assess the risk to organizational operations, organizational assets, and individuals resulting from the operation of organizational systems and the associated processing, storage, or transmission of CUI.

controls.title: Vulnerability Scanning
controls.description: Scan for vulnerabilities in organizational systems and applications periodically and when new vulnerabilities affecting those systems are identified.

controls.title: Vulnerability Remediation
controls.description: Remediate vulnerabilities in accordance with risk assessments, prioritizing critical and high-severity findings within defined timelines.
typical_evidence: Risk acceptance documentation for deferred remediation

controls.title: Risk Response
controls.description: Document and track risk responses, including risk acceptance, avoidance, mitigation, sharing, and transfer decisions for identified risks to CUI.

controls.title: Advanced Risk Analysis
controls.description: Employ advanced risk assessment techniques including threat modeling, attack surface analysis, and supply chain risk assessment for systems processing CUI.

domains.name: Security Assessment
domains.description: Periodically assess the security controls in organizational systems to determine if the controls are effective in their application and develop and implement plans of action to correct deficiencies.

controls.title: Security Control Assessment
controls.description: Periodically assess the security controls in organizational systems to determine if the controls are effective in their application.

controls.title: Plan of Action and Milestones
controls.description: Develop and implement plans of action designed to correct deficiencies and reduce or eliminate vulnerabilities in organizational systems.

controls.title: System Security Plan
controls.description: Develop, document, and periodically update system security plans that describe system boundaries, operating environment, security requirements, and the implementation of security controls.

controls.title: Continuous Monitoring
controls.description: Develop and implement a continuous monitoring strategy that includes ongoing assessment of security controls, status reporting, and active management of system security posture.

controls.title: Independent Security Assessment
controls.description: Employ independent assessors or assessment teams to conduct security control assessments and penetration testing to ensure objectivity and thoroughness.
typical_evidence: Corrective action tracking from independent findings

domains.name: System and Communications Protection
domains.description: Monitor, control, and protect organizational communications at the external boundaries and key internal boundaries of the information systems, and employ architectural designs, software development techniques, and systems engineering principles that promote effective information security.

controls.title: Boundary Protection
controls.description: Monitor, control, and protect communications at the external boundaries and key internal boundaries of information systems.

controls.title: Public Access System Separation
controls.description: Implement subnetworks for publicly accessible system components that are physically or logically separated from internal networks.
typical_evidence: Firewall rule sets for public/private separation

controls.title: CUI Encryption in Transit
controls.description: Implement cryptographic mechanisms to prevent unauthorized disclosure of CUI during transmission using FIPS-validated cryptography.

controls.title: CUI Encryption at Rest
controls.description: Implement cryptographic mechanisms to protect the confidentiality of CUI stored on digital media and at rest.

controls.title: Network Communication by Exception
controls.description: Deny network communications traffic by default and allow network communications traffic by exception (i.e., deny all, permit by exception).

controls.title: Collaborative Computing Devices
controls.description: Prohibit remote activation of collaborative computing devices and provide indication of devices in use to users present at the device.
typical_evidence: Physical indicator documentation (camera covers, mic indicators)

controls.title: Session Authenticity
controls.description: Protect the authenticity of communications sessions to prevent hijacking or man-in-the-middle attacks.

controls.title: CUI Separation
controls.description: Separate user functionality from system management functionality and isolate security functions from non-security functions.
typical_evidence: System architecture showing separation of duties

controls.title: Shared Resource Control
controls.description: Prevent unauthorized and unintended information transfer via shared system resources to protect against data leakage.

controls.title: Voice over IP Security
controls.description: Establish usage restrictions and implementation guidance for Voice over Internet Protocol (VoIP) technologies within the organization.

controls.title: DNS and Email Authentication
controls.description: Implement Domain Name System (DNS) filtering, email authentication (DMARC, DKIM, SPF), and other communication security measures.

controls.title: Advanced Communications Protection
controls.description: Employ advanced encryption, network segmentation, and zero-trust architecture principles to protect CUI communications with defense-in-depth strategies.

domains.name: System and Information Integrity
domains.description: Identify, report, and correct information and information system flaws in a timely manner, provide protection from malicious code, and monitor information system security alerts and advisories.

controls.title: Flaw Remediation
controls.description: Identify, report, and correct information and information system flaws in a timely manner.

controls.title: Malicious Code Protection
controls.description: Provide protection from malicious code at appropriate locations within organizational information systems.

controls.title: Security Alerts and Advisories
controls.description: Update malicious code protection mechanisms when new releases are available and monitor system security alerts, advisories, and directives.

controls.title: System and File Scanning
controls.description: Perform periodic scans of the information system and real-time scans of files from external sources as files are downloaded, opened, or executed.

controls.title: System Monitoring
controls.description: Monitor organizational systems to detect attacks and indicators of potential attacks including unauthorized local, network, and remote connections.

controls.title: Inbound and Outbound Traffic Analysis
controls.description: Monitor inbound and outbound communications traffic to detect unusual or unauthorized activities or conditions at system boundaries.

controls.title: Security Alert Response
controls.description: Identify unauthorized use of organizational systems and respond to security alerts, advisories, and directives from authoritative sources.

controls.title: Spam and Email Protection
controls.description: Implement email protection mechanisms including spam filtering, phishing detection, and attachment scanning at information system entry and exit points.
typical_evidence: Spam filter settings and effectiveness reports

controls.title: Input Validation
controls.description: Check the validity of security-relevant inputs from software programs and applications to prevent injection attacks and data corruption.
typical_evidence: Code review records showing input validation

controls.title: Advanced Threat Detection
controls.description: Employ advanced automated tools and techniques for detecting and analyzing threats, including behavioral analytics, sandboxing, and threat intelligence integration.

controls.title: Automated Response and Cyber Threat Intelligence
controls.description: Employ automated mechanisms to respond to security violations and integrate cyber threat intelligence feeds from government and commercial sources for proactive defense.
